description.narrative: Justice and Advocacy for Women and Children Uganda (JAWCU) is a National Non-Governmental organization registered in 2012, whose goal is to promote equal opportunities for women, children and other vulnerable groups to achieve economic independence and thereby facilitate meaningful participation in governance and development processes. In the quest to support women and children, JAWCU works with communities, local leaders and other partners both local and international in finding lasting solutions to women, children, youth and other vulnerable groups# issues. With support from Oxfam and in partnership with UYONET and YIYA, JAWCU implemented the #Enhancing Youth Livelihood for Social Transformation# a project and the Championship/Mentorship Project. The youth business mentorship project now draws from the previous project #Youth Livelihood Champion and Mentorship project# with an objective of giving support to the youth groups to harness their socio-economic potential and increase self-employment opportunities and sustainable income levels.This project will bring about an economically empowered youth positively engaged in development with the long term outcome being anempowered youth community with ability to transform their social and economic wellbeing through effective participation in development processes. The role of JAWCU in this project is to support the youth groups with attachment to business mentors (Local Artisans)to enhance their business/ entrepreneurial skills and through this support the youth will obtain a comprehensive perspective in practical business management and exposing them to available opportunities.

participating-org.narrative: JAWCU is a Non Governmental organization registered in 2012, whose goal is to promote equal opportunities for women, children and other vulnerable groups to achieve economic independence and thereby facilitate meaningful participation in governance and development processes. It is our desire to place especially young women at the centre of development. JAWCU aims to foster respect for and observance of human rights with emphasis on achieving equal opportunities for women, children and other marginalized group , through networking, promoting respect for human rights, good governance/transparency and accountability advocating for their empowerment , carrying out research, advocating for access to justice ,health and education, rights awareness so as to improve their living conditions. We plan to initiate economic empowerment programmes like micro-credit schemes and other income generating ventures. In the questto support women and children JAWCU works with communities, local leaders and other partners both local and international in finding lasting solutions to women ,children youth and other vulnerable groups# issues. The organisation was founded by Ms Evelyn NkaluboMuwemba, Ms Solome Luwaga, Mr.Saulo Muwemba and Dr. Patrick Luwaga. We have since appointed other Board members to give strategic direction to the organisation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
